titlestmt.titleproper:
Guide to the Julie Gilbert Papers
ca. 1940-1998
MSS 38 MSS 038
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Processed by Tanya Friedel, July 1998 and Jessica Shimmin, August 2003.

editionstmt.p: This version was derived from Gilbert Finding Aid.doc

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2009-11-20T15:22-0500

did.abstract: The Julie Gilbert Papers are the materials the writer used while researching her biography Opposite Attraction: The Lives of Erich Maria Remarque and Paulette Goddard.

custodhist.head: Provenance
custodhist.p: Julie Gilbert donated her papers in July 1998.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Open for research without restrictions. Appointments are necessary to consult archive and manuscript materials.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Collection use is subject to all copyright laws. Permission to publish materials must be obtained in writing from the Director of Fales Library and Special Collections. Please contact fales.library@nyu.edu. or call 212 998 2596.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p:
Published citations should take the following form:
Identification of item, date (if known); The Julie Gilbert Papers; MSS 038; box number; folder number; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University Libraries.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Julie Gilbert was born on July 21, 1949 in New York. Her father, Henry Goldsmith was a publisher and her mother, Janet, was an actress. She attended Boston University and has worked as a professional actress, writer and teacher. She has written biographies, novels and plays including Umbrella Steps,which became a film, and Ferber: The Biography of Edna Ferber and Her Circle,which was nominated for the National Book Critics Circle Award. She received a Pulitzer Prize nomination for Opposite Attraction,the result of the research contained in this collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The Julie Gilbert Papers are comprised of the original manuscript of Opposite Attractionand its various stages, production and publicity files, research files for the biography containing both personal and business correspondence of Remarque and Goddard, legal files, photo duplications, both hard copies and cassette tapes of individual interviews, printed material used for research, and computer disks. The Julie Gilbert Papers contain a comprehensive collection of Gilbert's research and production files for Opposite Attractionwith photocopied material dating from ca. 1940. Julie Gilbert's original organization of the archive was preserved as much as possible.
SERIES I: Written and Printed research materials
Includes clippings, notes, and published materials as well as translations and interview transcripts.
Includes audiocassettes, mini-cassettes and floppy disks containing recorded interviews, notes and drafts of the biography.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Julie Gilbert’s original organization of the archive was preserved as much as possible.
The files are grouped into 2 series:

list.item: I: Written and Printed research materials
